item.title: MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Ohio’s Third Grade Reading Guarantee is a program to identify students from kindergarten through third grade that are behind in reading.Under this program, schools are required to administer a reading diagnostic, also known as a screener, to all students in kindergarten through third grade each year to measure whether a student is on track.

The post MAP Growth Ohio Third Grade Reading Diagnostic appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: MAP Growth VPAT
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
This Voluntary Product Accessibility Template, or VPAT, is a document that educators and decision makers can use to evaluate how MAP Growth conforms with the WCAG 2.0 standards, AA rating.

The post MAP Growth VPAT appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
This Voluntary Product Accessibility Template, or VPAT, is a document that educators and decision makers can use to evaluate how MAP Growth conforms with the WCAG 2.0 standards, AA rating. Here is additional information on the VPAT and the WCAG 2.0 Guidelines that NWEA conforms to, which ensures that MAP Growth is accessible to students with a visual impairment.

The post MAP Growth VPAT appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments
item.dc:creator: Taylor Riordan
item.description:
NWEA provides a linking study (historically called the “generic linking study”) for partners who do not currently have a state linking study. This linking study provides a research-backed and statistically

The post Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
NWEA provides a linking study (historically called the “generic linking study”) for partners who do not currently have a state linking study. This linking study provides a research-backed and statistically sound method of projecting a student’s proficiency level using MAP Growth data. We now have an updated version of this linking study. The way we refer to the study is changing from “generic linking study” to “default linking study.” For more information, please visit NWEA Connection.

The post Default Cut Scores for MAP Growth Reading and Mathematics Assessments appeared first on NWEA.
